lead_paragraph: AMONG the defects that have been learnedly urged against "The Wookey" is the fact that the war has contributed more drama to it than the author has, Mr. Wookey's salty and pungent independence, it is said, would not be dramatic if a devastating war were not dropping out of the skies, murdering ordinary citizens and laying waste the pathetic homes that men have raised against the cold and wet of nature.
